result.execSummary:
The defendant Kemont Donnelle Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *The Court ordered Defendant to pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements CONCURRENT to 14CF5249.  If not paid, will convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kemont Donnelle Boyd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kemont Donnelle Boyd in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Kemont Donnelle Boyd in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.    AS TO COUNTS #1, #2 AND #4:  Pursuant to negotiations and on the State's Motion, the Court orders that counts #1, #2 and #4 DISMISSED and read-in for purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered. 

Matter is adjourned for sentencing on November 9, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
Per the request for substitution against Judge Conen filed by defense.
against Judge Conen filed by defense.  The newly assigned court is Judge Stephanie Rothstein's Court.

Defendant Kemont Donnelle Boyd in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Kemont Donnelle Boyd in custody.  Chad Wozniak for Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request an adjournment.
All parties notified effecive 08-01-2015, this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Conen, branch 30 in room 635 of the Courthouse.
Defense filed a request for substitution of judge today.
The newly assigned court is Judge Rothstein's Court post-rotation.
Case adjourned to 08-26-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 25, Judge Rothstein's Court for Adjourned Plea Hearing.

Defendant Kemont Donnelle Boyd in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Kemont Donnelle Boyd in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Court ordered case adjourned for Plea Hearing on 06-23-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 02, Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Kemont Donnelle Boyd in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Kemont Donnelle Boyd in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.
filed by ADA Joy Hammond on behalf of the State.
FILED, DEMAND FOR DISCOVERY AND INSPECTION

- NO FILE IN COURT -
Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Kemont Donnelle Boyd not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case adjourned to 05-04-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Preliminary Hearing.

Upon the parties' request, Clerk in Judge Donald's Court removed the Preliminary Hearing date before Preliminary Court on 05-05-2015.  Case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing before Judge Donald's Court on 04-29-2015 at 8:30 AM.

Defendant Kemont Donnelle Boyd in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Kemont Donnelle Boyd in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Plea Withheld as to Count 3 & Count 4 until the next court hearing.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.



CASE RECALLED AT 2:40PM.
SAME APPEARANCES. 

Court advises defendant advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
